title: ATS: How Applicant Tracking Systems Actually Work
subtitle: ATS systems store, rank, and help recruiters search candidates. They rarely auto-reject based on resume content alone. The real gate is human time and attention.

studySnapshot.whatItStudied: How ATS systems are used in hiring workflows, and where automation influences screening
studySnapshot.sample: Academic studies, ATS vendor help docs (Greenhouse, Lever, Workday), eye-tracking research
studySnapshot.keyFinding: Human time and attention, not algorithmic rejection, is the primary bottleneck
studySnapshot.keyStat: Human review is the primary bottleneck
studySnapshot.soWhatForResumes: Resume clarity and structure matter because humans still skim under time pressure

figures.title: ATS workflow: database and ranking, not automatic deletion
figures.caption: ATS systems organize candidates into searchable databases. Recruiters use filters, keyword search, and ranking to prioritize review. Auto-archive typically applies only to knockout questions (visa status, certifications), not resume formatting.

keyInsights.title: Knockout questions filter for eligibility
keyInsights.explanation: Auto-archive typically triggers on work authorization, required certifications, or location—not resume keywords.
keyInsights.riypImplication: We focus on clarity, not keyword stuffing, because content rarely triggers rejection.

keyInsights.title: Match scores rank, they don't delete
keyInsights.explanation: Some ATS compute relevance scores, but these prioritize candidates for review rather than auto-rejecting.
keyInsights.riypImplication: Our scoring simulates human impression, not ATS optimization.

keyInsights.title: Recruiters search the database
keyInsights.explanation: Recruiters use keyword and boolean searches to find candidates. ATS surfaces results; humans decide.
keyInsights.riypImplication: We help your resume communicate clearly to both systems and humans.

keyInsights.title: Stage rules manage pipeline flow
keyInsights.explanation: Automated emails, interview scheduling, and status updates are workflow features, not rejection mechanisms.
keyInsights.riypImplication: Recruiter First Impression focuses on the human skim, where decisions actually happen.

riypChanges.why: resume content rarely triggers automatic rejection—but unclear writing loses the human skim.
well-organized resumes get parsed correctly AND scanned faster by recruiters.
focuses on what a human sees first, because that is where decisions happen.
we do not sell fear-based optimization because the evidence does not support it.
